item.title: Ugh! making wild areas non wild :S
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

Sorry my bad, the one above was a bad post I wasn’t paying attention. Add a safe zone by adding the co-ordinates in brackets. Go to the the south-westerly most point in a shop and get the x and y co-ords of that point. They become your first ABSX and ABSY. The go to the most north-easterly point and get the X and Y co-ords of that point. They become your second ABSX and ABSY.

Read full topic

item.title: Ugh! making wild areas non wild :S
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

You wanna change it to this:

oh mmk but i mistaked this is all thats under it :S

im in quick reply so no code box

public boolean inwildy = false;
public boolean inwildy2 = false;
public void checkwildy()
{
if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3672) || (absX >=3365  && absX <=3371 && absY >=9768  && absY <=9771 ))
{
inwildy = true;
}
else
{
inwildy = true;
}
}
public void checkwildy2(){
if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3514))
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
else
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
}

And keep adding areas by putting || followed by more brackets with co-ords.

Read full topic

item.title: Ugh! making wild areas non wild :S
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

The first ABSX that you see is the x-position of the south west co-ordinate. The second ABSX is teh x-position of the north east co-ordinate. The first ABSY that you see is the y-postion of the south west co-ordinate. The second ABSY is the y-postion of the north east co-ordinate.

After the co-odinates are added, it makes a box that is wildy.

Read full topic
